item.title: Draggable location
item.description: Imagine you have a plugin that renders something on the screen. Users might want to move it to a different location. Dragging’s a great way to make it move, and here’s how to get it to work! First, you need to be rendering something on the canvas. Let’s say it’s a single chunk of text, with its location defined at the top left. Like this example. Next we’ll add a simple level of customizability with location cvars.

item.title: ImGui Basics
item.description: This section is dedicated to ImGui, a library used for creating a user-friendly interface. There’s buttons, sliders, checkboxes, dropdowns, and all sorts of options. It also assumes you’re using the template, as the template automatically includes the ImGui library. And here’s a useful interactable imgui demo to see what these look like in action https://pthom.github.io/imgui_manual_online/manual/imgui_manual.html
